intro: Turanecio munzurdaglarensis, commonly known as the Munzur Valley turanecio, is a rare flowering plant native to the Munzur Mountains in Turkey. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within its restricted habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
